TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ChatCompletionsOptions extends System.Object implements class System.ClientModel.Primitives.IJsonModel`1<class Azure.AI.OpenAI.ChatCompletionsOptions>, class System.ClientModel.Primitives.IPersistableModel`1<class Azure.AI.OpenAI.ChatCompletionsOptions>
Public Class ChatCompletionsOptions Implements IJsonModel(Of ChatCompletionsOptions), IPersistableModel(Of ChatCompletionsOptions)
type ChatCompletionsOptions = class interface IJsonModel<ChatCompletionsOptions> interface IPersistableModel<ChatCompletionsOptions>

Docs.summary: The configuration information for a chat completions request. Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes" provided prompt data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string deploymentName, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Azure.AI.OpenAI.ChatRequestMessage> messages) cil managed
Public Sub New (deploymentName As String, messages As IEnumerable(Of ChatRequestMessage))

Docs.param: The deployment name to use for a chat completions request.

The collection of context messages associated with this chat completions request. Typical usage begins with a chat message for the System role that provides instructions for the behavior of the assistant, followed by alternating messages between the User and Assistant roles.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
Gets or sets the additional configuration details to use for Azure OpenAI chat completions extensions.
Docs.remarks: These extensions are specific to Azure OpenAI and require use of the Azure OpenAI service.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ChoiceCount As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.ChoiceCount : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of choices that should be generated per provided prompt. Has a valid range of 1 to 128.
Docs.remarks:
Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure reasonable settings for and .
is equivalent to 'n' in the REST request schema.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DeploymentName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The deployment name to use for a chat completions request.

remarks.para: When making a request against Azure OpenAI, this should be the customizable name of the "model deployment" (example: my-gpt4-deployment) and not the name of the model itself (example: gpt-4).
When using non-Azure OpenAI, this corresponds to "model" in the request options and should use the appropriate name of the model (example: gpt-4).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property EnableLogProbabilities As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.EnableLogProbabilities : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`. This option is currently not available on the `gpt-4-vision-preview` model.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property FrequencyPenalty As Nullable(Of Single)
member this.FrequencyPenalty : Nullable<single> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their cumulative frequency in generated text. Has a valid range of -2.0 to 2.0.
Docs.remarks: Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear as their frequency increases and decrease the model's likelihood of repeating the same statements verbatim.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.FunctionCall : Azure.AI.OpenAI.FunctionDefinition with get, set

Docs.summary: Controls how the model will use provided Functions.

list.item: Providing a custom will request that the model limit its completions to function calls for that function.
represents the default behavior and will allow the model to freely select between issuing a standard completions response or a call to any provided function.
will request that the model only issue standard completions responses, irrespective of provided functions. Note that the function definitions provided may still influence the completions content.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Functions As IList(Of FunctionDefinition)

Docs.summary: A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property LogProbabilitiesPerToken As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.LogProbabilitiesPerToken : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: An integer between 0 and 5 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxTokens As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxTokens : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of tokens to generate. Has minimum of 0.
Docs.remarks: is equivalent to 'max_tokens' in the REST request schema.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Messages As IList(Of ChatRequestMessage)

Docs.summary: The collection of context messages associated with this chat completions request. Typical usage begins with a chat message for the System role that provides instructions for the behavior of the assistant, followed by alternating messages between the User and Assistant roles. Please note is the base class. According to the scenario, a derived class of the base class might need to be assigned here, or this property needs to be casted to one of the possible derived classes. The available derived classes include , , , and .
Docs.remarks: This is the full set of chat messages for the history of a conversation between an assistant and user. Typical usage begins with a chat message for the System role that provides instructions for the behavior of the assistant followed by alternating messages between the User role and Assistant role.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property NucleusSamplingFactor As Nullable(Of Single)
member this.NucleusSamplingFactor : Nullable<single> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or set a an alternative value to , called nucleus sampling, that causes the model to consider the results of the tokens with probability mass.
Docs.remarks:
As an example, a value of 0.1 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 10% of probability mass to be considered.
It is not recommended to modify and for the same chat completions request as the interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.
is equivalent to 'top_p' in the REST request schema.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property PresencePenalty As Nullable(Of Single)
member this.PresencePenalty : Nullable<single> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their existing presence in generated text. Has a valid range of -2.0 to 2.0.
Docs.remarks: Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear when they already exist and increase the model's likelihood to output new topics.

Docs.summary: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Used to enable JSON mode. Please note is the base class. According to the scenario, a derived class of the base class might need to be assigned here, or this property needs to be casted to one of the possible derived classes..

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Seed As Nullable(Of Long)
member this.Seed : Nullable<int64> with get, set

Docs.summary: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the system_fingerprint response parameter to monitor changes in the backend."

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StopSequences As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: Gets a list of textual sequences that will end completions generation. A maximum of four stop sequences are allowed.
Docs.remarks: is equivalent to 'stop' in the REST request schema.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Temperature As Nullable(Of Single)
member this.Temperature : Nullable<single> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions. Has a valid range of 0.0 to 2.0 and defaults to 1.0 if not otherwise specified.
Docs.remarks:
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify and for the same chat completions request as the interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TokenSelectionBiases As IDictionary(Of Integer, Integer)

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of modifications to the likelihood of specified GPT tokens appearing in a chat completions result. Maps token IDs to associated bias scores from -100 to 100, with minimum and maximum values corresponding to a ban or exclusive selection of that token, respectively.
Docs.remarks:
Token IDs are computed via external tokenizer tools. The exact effect of specific bias values varies per model.
is equivalent to 'logit_bias' in the REST request schema.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ToolChoice : Azure.AI.OpenAI.ChatCompletionsToolChoice with get, set

Docs.summary: If specified, the model will configure which of the provided tools it can use for the chat completions response.
